text: ਰਾਗੁ ਗਉੜੀ ਗੁਆਰੇਰੀ ਅਸਟਪਦੀ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀ ਕੀ
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Gauree Gwaarayree, Ashtapadees Of Kabeer Jee:

transliteration.text: rāg gaurī guārērī asatapadī kabīr jī kī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਸੁਖੁ ਮਾਂਗਤ ਦੁਖੁ ਆਗੈ ਆਵੈ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: People beg for pleasure, but pain comes instead.

transliteration.text: sukh mānhgat dukh āgai āvai .

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The emotions are conveyed in a direct and disciplined way. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਸੋ ਸੁਖੁ ਹਮਹੁ ਨ ਮਾਂਗਿਆ ਭਾਵੈ ॥੧॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I would rather not beg for that pleasure. ||1||

transliteration.text: sō sukh hamah n mānhgiā bhāvai .1.

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The emotions are conveyed in a direct and disciplined way. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

text: ਬਿਖਿਆ ਅਜਹੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸੁਖ ਆਸਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: People are involved in corruption, but still, they hope for pleasure.

transliteration.text: bikhiā ajah surat sukh āsā .

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The emotions are conveyed in a direct and disciplined way. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

text: ਕੈਸੇ ਹੋਈ ਹੈ ਰਾਜਾ ਰਾਮ ਨਿਵਾਸਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: How will they find their home in the Sovereign Lord King? ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: kaisē hōī hai rājā rām nivāsā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

text: ਇਸੁ ਸੁਖ ਤੇ ਸਿਵ ਬ੍ਰਹਮ ਡਰਾਨਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Even Shiva and Brahma are afraid of this pleasure,

transliteration.text: is sukh tē siv braham darānā .

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: but I have judged that pleasure to be true. ||2||

transliteration.text: sō sukh hamah sāch kar jānā .2.

text: ਸਨਕਾਦਿਕ ਨਾਰਦ ਮੁਨਿ ਸੇਖਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Even sages like Sanak and Naarad, and the thousand-headed serpent,

transliteration.text: sanakādik nārad mun sēkhā .

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: did not see the mind within the body. ||3||

transliteration.text: tin bhī tan mah man nahī pēkhā .3.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Anyone can search for this mind, O Siblings of Destiny.

transliteration.text: is man kau kōī khōjah bhāī .

translation.text: When it escapes from the body, where does the mind go? ||4||

transliteration.text: tan shūtē man kahā samāī .4.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, Jai Dayv and Naam Dayv

transliteration.text: gur parasādī jaidēu nāmānh .

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: came to know this, through loving devotional worship of the Lord. ||5||

transliteration.text: bhagat kai prēm in hī hai jānānh .5.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This mind does not come or go.

transliteration.text: is man kau nahī āvan jānā .

text: ਜਿਸ ਕਾ ਭਰਮੁ ਗਇਆ ਤਿਨਿ ਸਾਚੁ ਪਛਾਨਾ ॥੬॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One whose doubt is dispelled, knows the Truth. ||6||

transliteration.text: jis kā bharam gaiā tin sāch pashānā .6.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This mind has no form or outline.

transliteration.text: is man kau rūp n rēkhiā kāī .

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By God's Command it was created; understanding God's Command, it will be absorbed into Him again. ||7||

transliteration.text: hukamē hōiā hukam būjh samāī .7.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Does anyone know the secret of this mind?

transliteration.text: is man kā kōī jānai bhēu .

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. text: ਇਹ ਮਨਿ ਲੀਣ ਭਏ ਸੁਖਦੇਉ ॥੮॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This mind shall merge into the Lord, the Giver of peace and pleasure. ||8||

transliteration.text: ih man līn bhaē sukhadēu .8.

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

text: ਜੀਉ ਏਕੁ ਅਰੁ ਸਗਲ ਸਰੀਰਾ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: There is One Soul, and it pervades all bodies.

transliteration.text: jīu ēk ar sagal sarīrā .

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਇਸੁ ਮਨ ਕਉ ਰਵਿ ਰਹੇ ਕਬੀਰਾ ॥੯॥੧॥੩੬॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Kabeer dwells upon this Mind. ||9||1||36||

transliteration.text: is man kau rav rahē kabīrā .9.1.36.

melody.description: Gauri Guarairi contains a mixture of calmness and control in feeling, however the emotional message of the Raag is open and truthful in its approach. The emotions are conveyed in a direct and disciplined way. The balanced and focused character of this Raag is evident in its structure, in that its scale is restricted to ‘madh saptak’ (middle scale).

author.author: Saint Kabir
